title: Add The Advanced 7-Minute Workout
body: Please include the [Advanced Workout](https://well.blogs.nytimes.com/2014/10/24/the-advanced-7-minute-workout/)

title: Does not start workout, only if skipping first exercise
body:
When I swipe up to start the workout, it displays "a short break", but nothing else happens. The only way to start the workout is swiping horizontally to the next exercise: then the counter begins and the workout starts from the 2nd exercise.

I installed version 2.3 from F-droid (tried reinstalling, same problem); running Android 6 on a Moto G2 (XT1078). Thanks for this great app!

title: Update to the Spanish translation
body:
I've updated the spanish translation with the remaining strings and reviewed current ones to follow some good practices.
Hope it's correct and able to be merged soon.

title: Add option to pause background music during audio playback
body:
Hi, cool app, thanks for releasing it as open source! For listening to podcasts etc. during the workout maybe also some other people might find the following useful. I also optimized the TTS usage a bit. These changes just would need translations for the following strings (except en/de):

- action_no_audio_overlap
- action_no_audio_overlap_summary

title: Play store
body:
A few days ago I received an notification for an update of "Sieben". From then on it depends on Google Play services, contains ads and is for girls. I guess it's a fork of your app uploaded to the play store without changing the signature. Here is a link:

[https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=de.baumann.sieben](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=de.baumann.sieben)

An other copy (which seems to be identical) is:
[https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=de.baumann.sieben1](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=de.baumann.sieben1)

title: Unclear image license
body: What license do the images used in the project have?

title: additional audio output: half time, 3, 2, 1
Whistle stops after the 7th exercise.
body: Whistle stops when  "plank" begins and doesn't occur in the followings exercises.

title: UPDATE fr translations
body: Hi. Some strings were missing an FR translation. I also updated some of the existing translations for clarity

title: No Voice Commands
body:
Hi,

I hear no voice commands, running the app on an Android 6 machine.
Any ideas?

Regards

title: Intro screen
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: Replacement for the help dialog at apps first start.

title: About screen
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: License, Changelog, Donation at one place.

title: Endless training
body: Maybe you could add a function where i get of all my chosen exercises a random trainplan. And it repeated endless. For some reason's its good not to follow ever the same interval. Your body know what's todo and the progress gets lowered. So i heard about it.

title: Free adjustable time for exercises.
body: I like how it works. But what if o want to train 70 second's? :) or only 15 becouse beginner with no fitness at all.

title: Setup different times for specific exercises
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body: Because i have a trainplan with where i need todo some of them longer.  Maybe procedural term of standard lenght. Or a way to increase and decrease specific exercises in m seconds.

title: Setup pause delay
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="help wanted")]
body: Like the title say. It would be nice to setup the length of pause.

title: Own Exercises
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="help wanted")]
body:
I would like to setup own exercises in the app.

Btw: deine app ist echt klasse.

title: Scroll View changes state on device rotation
body:
When I perform this sequence of events, the scroll view on screen goes back to the top

Sequence 1:
1. Click on ...
2. Click on Settings
3. Click on Exercises
4. Scroll Down
5. Orientation Change

Sequence 2:
1. Click on ...
2. Click on Settings
3. Scroll Down
4. Orientation Change

title: Dialogs disappear on device rotation
body:
When i perform these sequences of events, the dialog on screen disappears

1. Click on ... to open action overflow menu
2. Click on Settings
3. Click on 
a. Duration
b. Help
c. License
4. Orientation Change

title: Updated Japanese translations
body: Hello!

title: Allow user to add exercices
label: [Label(name="wontfix")]
body:
I would like to know it here is an easy way to add some exercices. Are they stored in some file ?
The best would be to have 
- a CSV file with title, description, image name, default duration
- a system to read this csv file and create exercices
- show images stored relatively from the csv file

This would let your tool
- be easily customisable
- have people contributing to the list of exercices very easily

For example

| title | description | body_parts | category | image | default_duration |
| :-: | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Stretch neck | Let your head drop on one side. Stay 5 seconds. Move to the other side. Stay 5 secondes | neck, shoulder | stretching | my-neck-stretching-exercice.png | 120 |
| Superman | On your knees, hands on the ground, rise one leg and the opposite arm, stretch, keep 10 seconds, and reverse side | abs, back | stretching, reinforcement | my-superman-image.jpg | 60 |

title: Whistle sound and German strings
body: Hi! Thanks for the great app, it's just what I searched for! I came around to add a referee whistle sound as well as fix some translations to more common terms for the exercises (looked them up in Wikipedia). Maybe you find my changes useful, the merge should work out well, the mp3 file is CC0 and very small. cheers, Mathias

title: Jumping Over Exercise Number Two
body:
Hello Gaukler,
I got a Huawei Honor 4c running Android version 6 and installed the app from f-droid. Then i opened the app, swiped up and started the exercises. After exercise number one and a short break, it jumps over exercise number two and started exercise number three!
FYI, all the exercises are selected in settings activity.
So, what's the matter?!

sorry for my bad english :sweat_smile:

title: Easier workout
label: [Label(name="wontfix")]
body: The app is really great! Would it be possible to generate an easier version of the workout, e.g. for older or completely untrained people? Maybe just replace the pictures with easier variants. (Wall sit with higher rest, push ups with hands on chair or table, stair in place of chair, etc.)

title: Change duration of exercices
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Hi, I love your app and the minimal approach and the fact it's FOSS! It's great.

Just wanted to know if it would be possible to add an option in the settings to change the duration of the exercices.
Instead of having 30 secondes, I would be able to change it to 45 secondes or 60 secondes.
That would be awesome.

title: Skipped exercises continues to run in background
label: [Label(name="question")]
body:
Hi,

I have a massive problem since (I guess) version 1.5
Everytime I want to skip an exercise then new exercise appears correctly with the pause, but, in the background, the old continues. When I skip several exercises, all skipped are running in the background. You can hear the name of the exercise and so on. The only chance I have is to kill the application.
I can send you a video when it helps.

title: Link to almost fearless
body:
Small issue.
The link to the blog with the pictures for the exercise is broken, because the "Thanks" is included. 

http://almostfearless.com/the-21-minute-workout-or-7-minutes-if-youre-really-fit).Thanks

title: Do we need the fab-button?
body: ... since we have swipe gestures? What's your opinion? I would be glad, of you give me feedback.

title: add a pause before the first exercise
body: Could you add 10 or 5 seconds before the first exercise starts? Then it's possible to prepare after starting the app.

title: APK is 4x bigger after moving images out of drawable folder
body:
Hello, version 1.5 is almost four times bigger compared to 1.4 (21,3MB vs 5,4MB). This is mainly caused by the fact that you moved the exercise pictures out of drawable and are now duplicated in each mipmap folder.
I don't know precisely what are the suggested standards for Android applications regarding images location but I think that using those directories is useful only if you need different images size for different display resolutions. In this way each directory contains exactly the same files increasing the apk size without any actual benefit.
As I said I don't what is the best practice for Android but I feel like it would be better if you move those images back to the drawable folder or anywhere resolution independent images should reside.

title: build folder should not be tracked by git
body:
Hi, your git repository should include only code (and other resources like graphics or anything else you app needs) and not the build folders or the editor specific folders.
Right now the zip file of you latest release is ~100MB which is **huge!**
I suggest you to google _"gitignore android studio"_ or something similar to better understand why and how you should do this. :smiley:

title: exercise enhancement
body:
It would be really helpful when you make a 3 seconds break after 15 seconds in the side plank exercise.
So you can switch sites.

Maybe also a text in the bottom that say to you to turn sites.

title: Start exercice new when swiping
body: Wenn I swipe in the background to the top, the exercise (2.) is starting from the beginning. I mean that the counter was reseted and started again.

title: add voice output
body:
Hi,

thanks for this app!
It would be great, if the app had a voice output, either artificial (text-to-speech), or natural language (i.e., just play pre-recorded files.)
With this you would not not have to look at your phone to see
- what to do next
- when the time for the exercise is finished

Thanks, 
silberzwiebel

title: GitHub link in Help is broken
body:
The link points to .../scoute-dich/Seven.
But it schould point to .../scoute-dich/Sieben.

Mfg Wabuo

title: Change of page orientation restarts exercise
body:
Hi,

Thanks for intoducing the gestures, it works like a charm.

I have another issue, while an exercise is running, my tablet changes sometimes the page orientation (portrait and landscape mode). This triggers a restart of the exercise. So it would be good, when the exercise continues with the same rest time.
By the way, actually there are two menu entries with help, I think the second should be labeled with "changelog"

title: Fix lint issues or disable specific warning/error
body: Current release does not build until `android { lintOptions { disable 'MissingTranslation' } }` is specified. Such modifications should be handled by upstream, since only you can know when it's okay to ignore lint issues.

title: Gestures
body: It would be nice, if one could skip an excercise by simply swiping to the left and going back by swiping to the inverse side.

title: Detecting touch gestures for next/previous exercise
body:
Hi,
At first, I love this app. Simple and straight forward.

Maybe you could detecting touch gestures for stepping to the next/previous exercise.
Opening the menu and hitting the small buttons is sometimes very hard. Especially when I don't wear my glasses.

On an other issue you mentioned, that you're not so familiar with developing. Here is a small example how it is working:
[http://stackoverflow.com/questions/13095494/how-to-detect-swipe-direction-between-left-right-and-up-down/](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/13095494/how-to-detect-swipe-direction-between-left-right-and-up-down/)

title: Phone locks while working out
body:
Hey there,

I tried the app and it is great, easy and simple! But my phone turns black while I was working on myself. So maybe it would be great to not let the phone turn off, while the app is working. 

Greetings MAW

title: Use English as default locale
body: Right now, when you are using an unsupported locale (Spanish, French, Chinese, etc.), everything is in German by default.

title: score list
label: [Label(name="enhancement"), Label(name="help wanted")]
body:
Wonderful APP.
Thanks for it love all your Apps.
Maybe you could add a score list with a overview how much exercises and minutes I train everday?
Maybe also a setting, to select a type of body I want to train, legs, arms something like that.
